de.kerner.commons.file
Class FileUtils

java.lang.Object
  de.kerner.commons.file.FileUtils

public class FileUtils
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class for commonly used File operations.

Author:
Alexander Kerner

fileCheck

public static boolean fileCheck(java.io.File file,
                                boolean createIfAbsend)
Extended accessibility test, if a file is available for reading.
it consists of following tests:

file.exists() && file.canRead() && file.isFile() && file .length()!= 0

Parameters:
file - file, that is checked.
createIfAbsend - if !file.exists(), it will be created.
Returns:
true, if file is accessible, false otherwise.

dirCheck

public static boolean dirCheck(java.io.File dir,
                               boolean createIfAbsend)
Extended accessibility test, if a directory is available for reading.
it consists of following tests:

dir.exists() && dir.canRead() && dir.isDirectory() && dir.length() != 0

Parameters:
dir - directory, that is checked.
createIfAbsend - if !dir.exists(), it will be created.
Returns:
true, if dir is accessible, false otherwise.

objectToFile

public static void objectToFile(java.io.Serializable s,
                                java.io.File file)
                         throws java.io.IOException

Write an Object that implements Serializable to a file.

Serialisation is buffered: Internally a BufferedOutputStream is used.

Parameters:
s - Object that will be serialized
file - file to write to
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if anything goes wrong
See Also:
Serializable

objectToStream

public static void objectToStream(java.io.Serializable s,
                                  java.io.OutputStream stream)
                           throws java.io.IOException

Write an Object that implements Serializable to an OutputStream.

Serialisation is buffered: Internally a BufferedOutputStream is used.

Parameters:
s - Object that will be serialized
sstream - stream to write to
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if anything goes wrong
See Also:
Serializable

isBinary

public static boolean isBinary(java.io.File file)
                        throws java.io.IOException

Tries to check whether file content is binary or not.

Parameters:
file - File which is tested.
Returns:
true, if this file is a binary file; else otherwise. Returning of false is reliable, whereas a returning of false might be incorrect.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
